FIX: CRITICAL — HeadlessSP SSO authentication failure. THREE compounding root causes identified and fixed: (1) chrome-headless-shell (bundled Playwright binary) lacks full SSPI/Negotiate support — now uses system Microsoft Edge (channel='msedge') which ships with Win10/11 and has full Windows Integrated Auth. (2) Playwright's new_context() creates incognito-like ephemeral contexts where Chrome 81+ disables ambient NTLM/Negotiate auth — switched to launchPersistentContext() with temp user_data_dir which creates a regular profile. (3) Added --enable-features=EnableAmbientAuthenticationInIncognito as belt-and-suspenders

FIX: Browser channel priority changed from chrome→bundled to msedge→chrome→bundled. Microsoft Edge is always available on Windows 10/11 and uses the 'new headless mode' (full browser binary with complete networking/auth stack), unlike chrome-headless-shell which is a stripped-down wrapper around Chromium's content module
FIX: User-Agent string updated to include Edge identifier (Edg/131.0.0.0) for proper WiaSupportedUserAgents matching on AD FS servers
ENH: Temp user_data_dir cleanup in close() prevents disk accumulation from browser profiles

FIX: CRITICAL — Playwright browser binary not installed. The playwright Python package was present but 'playwright install chromium' was never run, so HeadlessSPConnector.launch() failed with 'Executable doesn't exist'. Apply script now runs 'python -m playwright install chromium' automatically

FIX: Deduplicated auth-server-allowlist entries in HeadlessSPConnector. Identity provider domains were added to both CORP_AUTH_DOMAINS (v6.1.4) and _ensure_browser() extras, causing each domain to appear twice in the Chromium launch args
ENH: Apply script v6.1.5 focuses on Playwright browser installation with clear success/failure diagnostics and manual fallback instructions

FIX: CRITICAL — HeadlessSPConnector authentication rewritten for federated SSO (Azure AD + ADFS). Previous version navigated directly to /_api/web which triggered a redirect to login.microsoftonline.us that was immediately detected as 'login page' and returned failure before SSO could complete. Now navigates to site homepage first, waits for full federated redirect chain (SharePoint → Azure AD → ADFS → back), then verifies via page.evaluate(fetch())

FIX: Auth allowlist expanded to include identity provider domains (*.microsoftonline.com, *.microsoftonline.us, *.windows.net, *.adfs.*). The Negotiate/Kerberos challenge happens on the ADFS server during federated auth, not on SharePoint — so the ADFS domain MUST be in --auth-server-allowlist

NEW: SharePoint connector file logging — aegis.sharepoint logger now writes to logs/sharepoint.log (RotatingFileHandler, 5MB, 2 backups). Previously all connector diagnostics went to stdout only, invisible in exported logs

ENH: Three-phase authentication flow — Phase 1: Navigate to site (triggers SSO). Phase 2: Wait up to 30s for redirect chain to return to SharePoint domain. Phase 3: Verify via REST API fetch() in browser context

ENH: Detailed SSO failure diagnostics — detects password form (ADFS Windows Integrated Auth not configured), timeout (auth server unreachable), and unexpected URL (wrong redirect). All logged to sharepoint.log
ENH: Error messages now reference logs/sharepoint.log for detailed diagnostics

NEW: Headless browser SharePoint connector — when REST API authentication fails (e.g., AADSTS65002 in GCC High), AEGIS automatically falls back to a Playwright-powered headless browser that uses the same Windows SSO credentials as Chrome. Zero OAuth or config.json editing required

ENH: Browser lifecycle management — one browser instance for entire scan session, auto-cleanup on close. SSO session persists across all API calls and file downloads
